availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Mary Hutchins Bruner. Father of Eddy Bruner, Lee Bruner, and Freddy Bruner. Member of the Masonic Order at Pellville Lodge, No. 357 in Pellville, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 257; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 134; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 21; "George W. Bruner," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=89300131&ref=acom) (accessed on April 10, 2017).
